title: Dispute Guidance page: remove free-text flow and expand category guidance rendering

requirements.summary: Remove the free-text “Describe Your Dispute” chatbot UI and keep category selection as the only workflow on the Dispute Guidance page.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Dispute Guidance page, users no longer see a “Describe Your Dispute” tab/section or any textarea-based free-text input.
The Dispute Guidance page only presents the dispute category selection workflow (no tabs needed unless additional non-chatbot modes remain).
No build errors from removed imports/references (e.g., DisputeChatbotPanel no longer imported/used).

file_operations.description: Remove Tabs-based UI and all imports/references to the free-text workflow; render only the category-selection workflow (DisputeCategorySelector) while keeping the existing header and disclaimer visible.
Delete the free-text chatbot panel component to ensure it cannot be rendered or imported after removing it from the Dispute Guidance page.

requirements.summary: Ensure the category-selection workflow displays the expanded, category-specific guidance fields returned by the backend (examples, suitability guidance, next steps, do’s/don’ts, legal-information notes) for each of the six fixed categories.
acceptanceCriteria: For each of the six selectable categories (family, business, employment, property/landlord-tenant, consumer, neighborhood), the displayed guidance includes: examples, suitability notes (including caveats), next steps, do’s, don’ts, and legal-information notes.

The content is written in English, uses a professional but approachable tone, avoids heavy legal jargon, and includes a clear informational/not-legal-advice framing consistent with the existing page disclaimer.
The category-selection workflow continues to work end-to-end (select category → fetch guidance → display expanded content) without regressions.

file_operations.description: Refactor result rendering to use the backend GuidanceResult shape (category + fullDispute) and display the expanded fields: contextSpecificExamples, mediationSuitabilityGuidance, nextSteps, dosAndDonts (dos/donts), and legalInformation, while continuing to show category-level suitability (category.isMediationSuitable + category.mediationReason). Ensure no references remain to legacy fields (e.g., steps/additionalAdvice/mediationSuitable) that are not part of the current backend types.

Align hook typings/usages (if needed) to consistently return and consume GuidanceResult as defined in frontend/src/backend.d.ts, and remove any now-unused description-based guidance hook usage references introduced by deleting the chatbot UI (keep exports only if still used elsewhere).

requirements.summary: Present the expanded guidance in a clear, scannable, mobile-friendly, accessible layout using headings and semantic lists, while keeping the existing not-legal-advice disclaimer visible.
acceptanceCriteria: After selecting a category, the results area renders distinct sections for: Examples, Is mediation suitable?, Recommended next steps, Do’s, Don’ts, and Legal information (wording may vary but meaning must match).
Lists are rendered as semantic lists (ul/ol) where appropriate and are readable on small screens without horizontal scrolling.
The existing disclaimer remains visible on the page and continues to state the tool is not legal advice.

file_operations.description: Update the results UI to a sectioned, scannable layout: use clear headings, consistent spacing, and semantic lists (ul/ol) for examples/next steps/do’s/don’ts; ensure responsive typography and spacing for mobile (no horizontal scrolling) and maintain accessible structure (e.g., heading order, list semantics).
Verify the disclaimer card remains visible on the page after removing tabs/chatbot, and ensure the category-selection results area appears beneath it in a readable, mobile-friendly layout.
